name: Accredited ITIL Intermediate - RCV
subtitle: Release Control and Validation
description: The ITIL:Release, Control, & Validation show centers around the 7 processes within the ITIL Service Transition Publication.  ITIL RCV is based on practically apply the RCV processes that enable successful planning, testing and implementation of service management that brings business values to an organization.  The goal of the show is to provide framework for managing transitional changes, validating service management and helping organizations release & deploy the required service management lifecycle for an organization.
descriptionMD: The ITIL:Release, Control, & Validation show centers around the 7 processes within the ITIL Service Transition Publication.  ITIL RCV is based on practically apply the RCV processes that enable successful planning, testing and implementation of service management that brings business values to an organization.  The goal of the show is to provide framework for managing transitional changes, validating service management and helping organizations release & deploy the required service management lifecycle for an organization. For course completion certificates to be submitted for exams, please [contact PassionIT Group](mailto:info@passionitgroup.com).

episodes.title: Overview
episodes.description: The ITIL:Release, Control, & Validation show centers around the 7 processes within the ITIL Service Transition Publication. ITIL RCV is based on practically apply the RCV processes that enable successful planning, testing and implementation of service management that brings business values to an organization. The goal of the show is to provide framework for managing transitional changes, validating service management and helping organizations release & deploy the required service management lifecycle for an organization.

episodes.title: Review and Orientation
episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Terry begin with a review of the ITIL foundations.  They focus in on the basic service model and vocabulary that a viewer is expected to understand and know.  They compare services to solutions and give different examples.  These foundational concepts of ITIL are built around customer needs.  This is important for those desiring to move deeper into the Release, Control and Validation.

episodes.title: Review and Orientation Part 2
episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Terry continue with the some the foundational vocabulary and concept to prepare for the Release, Control and Validation. They focus in on RACI, function and service.  The guys describe the use of the RACI matrix and its importance.  They also distinguish processes and services and put into the context of responsibility

episodes.title: Service Transition Overview
episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Terry introduce the ITIL Service Transition model.  They present a high level overview of service transition.  They guys briefly describe the scope and they discuss the business value of Service Transition.  Also presented by them is the service transition strategy as the guiding factor to this area of study.

episodes.title: Change Management
episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Terry introduce the concept of change management.  They emphasize the importance of change management for the company.  This includes not only the culture of the process but the buy in as well as stated by Terry.  The team describes the inputs, principles and values that change management brings to the company and we begin.  They also discuss the process of change requests and the use of a system to manage these changes.  Terry makes sure to emphasize that ITIL is not proscriptive in managing changes but provides a conceptual framework for what needs to be included in it.

episodes.title: Change Management Part 2
episodes.description: {description}In this episode, Ronnie and Terry take a look at the execution of change management.  They discuss brief, as a review of the accountability of change management and the authority of change management as well.  Part of execution is to understand the types of changes and how to remediate changes too, according to the team.  Some aspects of execution involve planning and scheduling as well reviewing the changes to set the priority and urgency of the change.

episodes.title: Change Management Part 3
episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Terry describe how to measure successful change management using SMART goals, Critical Success Factors, and Key Performance Indicators.  They also describe some of the challenges and risk to change management.  The team brief discusses that the improvement to service delivery involves organizational changes.  Lastly, a brief overview of the primary stakeholders to change management are defined by Terry.

episodes.title: Service Asset and Configuration Management
episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Terry introduce the process of service asset & configuration management.  They begin by emphasizing the purpose of SACM and what some of the objectives to implementing a SACM system.  Terry also helps us to understand where to get started and that it’s first steps begin with policies that help to enforce the process.   The team also helps to define some of the configuration items that ITIL defines so that we’re ready for the exam too!

episodes.title: Service Asset and Configuration Management Part 2
episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Terry continue with some of the broad concepts of SACM.  They discuss the need to using a Configuration Management System with assets and configuration items as our main interface with the data from multiple systems holding asset and configuration information.  Along with this, they also take a look at the use of software and controlling software through the DML, the definitive media library.  These are foundational items needed for activities normally performed during the SACM process!

episodes.title: Service Asset and Configuration Management Part 3
episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Terry continue with a part 3 of understanding SACM.  They take a look at the concept of release, the accountability of execution.  This is important concept to know not only who but the scope of the change according to the team.  Terry also helps us to take at controls that need to be in place for the release to happen.  Part of the best practices with SACM is also accounting and reporting along with verification and auditing, says Terry.   They end with a brief overall review of the major concepts of SACM.

episodes.title: Service Validation and Testing
episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Terry introduce the process called service validation & testing.  They a look at the purpose of service validation and testing as a way of instilling confidence in the provider’s service.  The goal is to provide the better service to the customer by using testing models to eliminate pain points of service, according to the team.  Terry also emphasizes the key drivers to this process is the establishment and enforcement of good policies.  They also briefly introduce testing models and understanding the perspective of service customer.  They end with a brief look at continual service improvement as well.

episodes.title: Service Validation and Testing Part 2
episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Terry take a look at the activities involved with service validation & testing.  The team points out how validation and testing is adding controls that will be helpful in management, function and business value to the service provided.  SV&T helps in management by providing the steps needed to insure that we provide proper testing, according to the guys.  They emphasize that the result is a better product that functions well at the level we indicated and of course makes the product a valuable tool for the provider and a valued service for the customer.

episodes.title: Release and Deployment Management
episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Terry discuss the important process of Release & Deployment Management.  This goes beyond authorization into managing the execution of solutions, changes and elements we introduce into our IT environment, according to Terry.  They describe the nature, scope of the process as well as it’s business value to the customer and provider.  Terry also briefly describes the importance of policies to help with the process management.  They also define some terminology that is common in the realm of deployment management.

episodes.title: Release and Deployment Management Part 2
episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Terry discuss the four main phases of release & deployment management: Release and Deployment planning; Release build and test;Deployment, and Review and close.  These phases help us to understand this deployment management process easier and help us to not look at the what may seem to be overwhelming in scope!

episodes.title: Release and Deployment Management Part 3
episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Terry summarize and review the concepts of release and deployment management.  They remind us of the key concepts, roles and responsibilities, risks and challenges associated with implementing release and deployment management.  This process also integrates in with Change Management, SACM and even Service Validation & Testing processes to provide service transition.

episodes.title: Request Fulfillment
episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Terry take us through the concepts of request fulfillment.  They emphasize the goal request fulfillment is not so much about incident management as it is about fulfilling planned expectations.  They also discuss request fulfillment in terms of using a self-fulfillment portal or a service desk.  The key is not so much about the system that is in place but the formalization,adoption, and use of the system that is implemented along the way.  Also the team discusses the basic challenges and risks associated with request fulfillment process.

episodes.title: Change Evaluation
episodes.description: {Description}In this episode, Ronnie and Terry introduce a subset process of change management: change evaluation.  They describe the need for change evaluation is normally on a larger scope in terms of business strategy rather than on a technical implementation level.  These types of evaluations can effect the business outcome, the service operation and even the infrastructure of the organization, according to the guys.  Terry also describes some of key terminology, activities and factors (STORMPUP) that must be considered in the change evaluation.  Lastly, they summary the entire process with reminder to try and apply the knowledge learned!

episodes.title: Knowledge Management
episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie & Terry take a look into the knowledge management for service management.  The entire goal is have the knowledge ready for how needs it at the right time, according to the team.  They review the constant idea of the need and the scope.  With the nature of the “ocean” of information there of course needs one some type of system (SKMS) to help with the management, distribution and use of the data available, according to the guys.  They also emphasize there is no one system to do it all but it will require integration of multiple systems that may have data; it may require a custom system; it may require just record keeping that is indexed to allow for the discovery of that information.  This is not a topic to be overlooked, according to the guys.

episodes.title: Technology and Implementation
episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie & Terry take us back to the big picture of Service Management.  They explain the importance of keeping the big picture and not just the individual processes.  They remind us that each process is part of the whole and should be seen that way to help with a successful implementation of ITIL into our organization

episodes.title: Sample Paper Review
episodes.description: Terry and Zach go over four sample questions from the 'ITIL Intermediate Exams' ITIL Release Control and Validation section, with the end goal being how to determine your best answer for each. In this episode, Terry and Zach cover the first four questions.

episodes.title: Sample Paper Review Part 2
episodes.description: Terry and Zach go over 4 sample questions from the 'ITIL Intermediate Exams' ITIL Release Control and Validation section, with the end goal being how to determine your best answer for each. In this episode, Terry & Zach cover questions 5 through 8, and offer a direction to PassionITGroup.Com & Deckerheads@yahoo.com.
